data.title: Add widget for hiding resource previews.
data.body:
fixes #6542

Adds a new widget above resource previews to allow users to hide them.

Currently works for gradient, mesh, and texture resources. Would need to be implemented for sample and material previews as well, if they're ever re-implemented.

data.title: Fix Android build
data.body: Android builds failed after all the cast_to refactoring

data.title: Monitor: add hint, fix certain graph not drawn
data.body:
Add a hint that helps user discover monitor graph
Fix last row drawn outside when only one graph is in that row

(I thought "why this tab has a HSplitContainer" then discovered this wonderful feature. :P)

data.title: Cleanup tons of obsolete commented out code
data.body: Mostly in EditorNode, dropping some obsolete editor plugins and also a cleanup of ProjectSettings/EditorSettings.

data.title: Make Polygon2D emit an item_rect_changed if needed
data.body: This PR solves the problem of detecting when a Polygon2D's vertices change. Here's what I'm trying to achieve: get a signal each time a Polygon2D changed (esp. in the editor), so I can adjust other items that depend on the polygon. Example: I use the following to keep the green ball attached to the first polygon vertex at all times: ``` tool extends Polygon2D func _enter_tree(): connect("item_rect_changed", self, "on_item_rect_changed") func on_item_rect_changed(): get_node("../circle").set_position(transform * get_polygon()[0]) ``` With the current Polygon2D implementation, there seems no way to achieve this, as changes in vertices do not seem to generate any signals. The least I would expect is to get a `item_rect_changed`. This is what this PR implements. Obviously this is not an optimal solution, since changes to vertices do not actually imply item rect changes. So would introducing a new signal type "vertices_changes" be the better alternative? **EDIT** This PR no longer uses `item_rect_changed`, it now uses dedicated signal(s) and thus solves this last problem. ***END EDIT***

data.title: Script editor crashing when performing autocomplete
data.body:
**Operating system or device, Godot version, GPU Model and driver (if graphics related):** Windows 10, Godot Git https://github.com/godotengine/godot/commit/dd7145b778ea4884fd52f5efaf79dc55375c8465 compiled with MSVC 2017


**Issue description:**
The script editor always crashes when performing autocomplete, which is usually done by editing characters in a script.


**Steps to reproduce:** In the example project (see below), edit the `autoload/console.gd` script at line 55. Specifically, try editing the string that is passed to the `append_bbcode()` function there. Editing the script in other places (such as comments, or variable declarations) does not seem to cause a crash.

Stack trace:

![script_editor_backtrace](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/180032/29742508-dbb35a36-8a80-11e7-8aea-36d6a5c0c8d8.png)

**Link to minimal example project:** [godot-console.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/1253751/godot-console.zip)

data.title: Added a cursor column check.
data.body: Fixes glitch, when cursor is on column 0 of and indented line and you press return an extra indent is added.

data.title: EditorAudioBus: Rename delete_popup, disable delete for Master
data.body:
Rename `delete_popup` to `bus_popup`
Rename `_delete_pressed` to `_bus_popup_pressed`
Disable 'Delete Bus' option for Master Bus

data.title: The `warnings=no` SCons option has no effect when building with MSVC on Windows
data.body:
**Operating system or device, Godot version, GPU Model and driver (if graphics related):** Windows 10 Creators Update, Godot Git https://github.com/godotengine/godot/commit/dd7145b778ea4884fd52f5efaf79dc55375c8465, MSVC 2017

**Issue description:** The `warnings=no` SCons option has no effect when building with MSVC on Windows (on the screenshot below, it is used in conjunction with `verbose=no` and `progress=no`):

![scons_msvc_warnings](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/180032/29741972-1df22166-8a77-11e7-8e81-b6362ed1f779.png)

**Steps to reproduce:** Perform a Windows build using MSVC, passing `warnings=no` to the SCons command line.

data.title: Code editor: Don't play hide and seek with error label
data.body:
I found it annoying that the line/column count would jump based on whether an error is displayed or not.
I'm not sure why it was being hidden/shown in the first place, as it has no stylebox so just clearing the text is enough when there are no errors IMO.

Before:
![spectacle q27549](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4701338/29741436-5639da6e-8a6d-11e7-8d4d-25f2ef9b5cbe.png)
![spectacle f27549](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4701338/29741441-69921e96-8a6d-11e7-9547-dac6450f3259.png)

After:
![spectacle m27549](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4701338/29741428-1bcec722-8a6d-11e7-831e-5bbe15f7dea5.png)
![spectacle x27549](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4701338/29741430-2c0dbf8a-8a6d-11e7-8374-cb183f6579d6.png)

data.title: Add handy get_size() method to Image class
data.body:
Instead of always doing:

`Vector2 image_size = Vector2(image.get_width(), image.get_height())`

Simplifies to this:

`Vector2 image_size = image.get_size()`

data.title: ProjectSettings: Fix typo 'an setting' to 'a setting'
Color replace modulation option
data.body:
Modulation multiplies each pixels color of a canvas item.
I would like to have the option to replace each pixels color.

`color = vec4(replace_color.r, replace_color.g, replace_color.b, color.a);`

This is useful to recolour darker textures.
I'm particularly thinking about the dark editor icons. where modulation does nothing (multiply by 0...)

But I also can see other use cases. for example for a multicolour texture which should become singe color...

## implementation:
add a enum how to use the modulation color
```
modulation
    color
    modulation_type (replace, multiply...)
```

Add another value for modulation color and apply them after each other...

data.title: Add antialiased parameter to canvas_item_add_triangle_array
data.body:
The `canvas_item_add_triangle_array` use polygon item to draw but it is antilaiased as default so I add this option to make it is possiable to draw triangle arrays without antilaiased.

*Bugsquad edit:* Fixes #10461.

data.title: RtAudio warning while game is running, and audio has sound pops
data.body:
**Operating system or device, Godot version:**
Windows 10 64bit - Godot 2.1.4 RC

**Issue description:**
The warning "RtAudio output underflow!" shows up in the error log a few times per second while the game is running. And audio (specifically tested using the Platformer demo with the music) has a popping sound almost in sync with the warnings.

This was not present in 2.1.4 2017-08-17, the audio sounds completely normal in that build and there was no warnings.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Open any project or create a new project and run it.

data.title: [WIP] CameraServer class
data.body:
This is still early days but I got the first version to work on OSX so time to start getting some feedback.

There is a test project here that also implements the shader required to combine the Y and CbCr textures to a proper image:
https://github.com/BastiaanOlij/godot3_test_projects/tree/master/TestCameraServer

And yes you can get the camera to work in the editor by turning the camera on :)

The next step is to make this work as the background for a viewport (which is what you really want for AR type stuff) and then start making things work on the other platforms, iOS first as I can reuse the same classes and Windows next. 

Finally I'll update my ARKit project to use the camera server to make the ARKit camera image available so you do not double up on processing the image.

data.title: Add a new decomposition to Basis.
data.body: This new decomposition splits the basis into a rotation-reflection matrix and a positive scaling matrix, which is required for physics calculations.

data.title: CollisionPolygon Uses PoolVector2Array
data.body:
Windows 10, Godot 3.0 alpha1

**Issue description:**
<!-- What happened, and what was expected. -->
The CollisionPolygon node uses a PoolVector2Array instead of a PoolVector3Array, completely breaking functionality.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Create a new CollisionPolygon node. Problem is also present when trying to make a CollisionPolygon from code.

data.title: polygon2d editing using transparent overlay
data.body:
This is an alternative version of #10614 based on @RandomShaper's proposal of using transparent previews. I'm not sure if I got his idea right.

Here's what it looks like currently as far as I understood it:

![poly-transparent](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11859538/29727530-8c900866-89d4-11e7-8574-4c9195205421.gif)

Personally, I'd still prefer the original #10614 as a default/configurable default for two reasons:

(1) I don't personally see the use case where you really need to compare the new shape to the old shape in this way. To me it feels more like a technical gimmick that adds visual complexity to the editing (due to the transparency) without giving a real advantage.

(2) every pro design/vector app for people who are doing this kind of stuff all day long with really complex illustrations and vector shapes seems to change the shape as you edit it (they all skipped the preview lasso thing they had like 10 years ago due to technical limits of not being able to preview the changed shape in real time):

e.g. Inkscape:

![inkscape](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11859538/29727575-c8a81578-89d4-11e7-903a-f30e3d27cb74.gif)

e.g. Affinity Designer:

![affinity-designer](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11859538/29727579-cf9198d2-89d4-11e7-9148-f9530fdc2c12.gif)

data.title: Regression: drag and drop image to canvas crashes godot
data.body:
**Operating system or device, Godot version, GPU Model and driver (if graphics related):**
Arch Linux, Godot3 master commit https://github.com/godotengine/godot/commit/f75678a94f35bfdf177f1e13ba0f5824fec20e92


**Issue description:**
Using drag and drop to to e.g. add icon.png from the FileSystem docker to the canvas crashes Godot.
This issue must be a relatively new regession, since I don't remember it being present a couple of days ago.

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Create a new project
2. Add a root node (e.g. Node2D) and select it
3. try to drag icon.png to the canvas

console output is not very helpfull in this case, I think:

Tested with: clang 4.0.1 and  gcc 7.2.0

data.title: AutoUse "Pencil" editor tool on Polygon creation
data.body:
Automatically select the "pencil" tool when a Polygon is created/clicked on.
Completes #9023 . 
Affects Polygon, Polygon2D, CollisionPolygon2D, and NavigationPolygons.

First PR, be gentle :D

data.title: Fix get_scale().
data.body:
Scale is applied before rotation in Basis since #7438. Basis::get_scale() is one of the functions that wasn't correctly updated back then.

Let's see if this is the last of them :(

data.title: Add to In-Engine Scripting API Documentation with a Plugin
data.body:
Motivation:

1. I write a plugin.
2. I define an API for it.
3. I want people to be able to look up those classes and their associated properties, methods, and signals.

Ideal Features:

1. This information would show up in the API documentation in the engine.
2. People would be (ideally) able to look up this information on the Asset Library web page while perusing the plugin.
3. Clicking on a new class name in the Script Editor could let you jump to that class's documentation.

Something where we supply our own XML file to be read in and incorporated?

data.title: color picker and dimming
data.body:
**Operating system or device, Godot version, GPU Model and driver (if graphics related):**
Arch Linux, Godot 3 master

**Issue description:**
I know this might be an edge case and more of a minor issue, but I realized that trying to pick a color with the eyedropper from an area that is currently dimmed will not pick the original color, but the "dimmed color". This might happen when you are e.g. in the editor or project settings dialog and try to pick a color from your canvas. As a workaround one could of course disable dimming (temporarily), but this is still a little annoying.

data.title: Tabbed Container's children's Y position should account for TabHeight.
data.body:
**Operating system or device, Godot version, GPU Model and driver (if graphics related):**
Godot 2.1.3

**Issue description:**
I created a Tabbed Container and then created a panel child node.  Setting the panel's position to x,0 causes it to overlap the tab display.

**Expected behavior:**
Tabbed containers' children account for the offset of the tabs, similar to how children of Window Dialog use x,0 as the bottom of the title bar rather than cover it.

data.title: Reset audio bus volume
data.body: There should be a way to reset the volume of an audio bus back to 0 dB. It's not SUPER IMPORTANT or anything, but it would be nice to be able to bring a bus' volume back to an even 100% instead of having to guess visually. Something like a menu option when right-clicking the volume knob.

data.title: Optional typing in GDScript?
data.body:
I don't know if this would be needed or interesting to any developer, but I think it might be useful to have optional typing in GDScript and was hoping to have a discussion about it here.

I've been learning the programming language called "Nim" because it has a pretty friendly module for GDNative and I'm interesting in learning to contribute there (since C++ is difficult for me visually BUT unrelated to this, just some background). Nim is statically typed which I know GDSCript is dynamic but I came across a situation in which I might want to specify type to make things easier.

Mainly when writing a function, it'd be nice if I could specify the type of a variable that is allowed to be passed in so the code completion could know what I'm talking about, but I'm sure there are other advantages to this.

Something like
```gdscript
func myfunction(a, b : int, c : InputEvent , d : String = "Default Value"):
    (...)
```
Where a is dynamic, b-d are static but show what I think the syntax could look like.

I know you can specify type hint for the editor when using the export keyword, but you don't have to keep the variable at that type once the script executes. This idea could be against what GDScript is meant to be, or too much work for very little gain, but lets talk.
